name: df-perpg
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(cperpg, cmpt(s0, universe, copab(s1, s2, wa(wa(wcel(cv(s1), crn(cfv(clng, cv(s0)))), wcel(cv(s2), crn(cfv(clng, cv(s0))))), wrex(s3, cin(cv(s1), cv(s2)), wral(s4, cv(s1), wral(s5, cv(s2), wcel(cs3(cv(s4), cv(s3), cv(s5)), cfv(crag, cv(s0))))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ perpG =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { < s1, s2 > |((s1 ‚àà ran((LineG ` s0))‚àß s2 ‚àà ran((LineG ` s0)))‚àß ‚àÉ(s3 ‚àà(s1 ‚ãÇ s2), ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà s1, ‚àÄ(s5 ‚àà s2, <" s4 . s3 . s5 "> ‚àà(raG ` s0)))))})
comment: Define the "perpendicular" relation. Definition 8.11 of [Schwabhauser] p. 59. See ~ isperp . (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 8-Sep-2019.)
